Fields.DialogueText: Hi there, Captain!
Hello, Salt Lake City.
Oh, you can call me Saltshaker, Captain. "Salt Lake City" is a mouthful.

Fields.MenuText: If that's what you prefer.
You call me by my title and I'll call you by yours.
I don't know. I get uneasy when my ship shakes too much.

Fields.DialogueText: It is!
Captain, there's no reason to be so formal.
That just means you haven't been on a ship that does it well, Captain.
We're both on this ship together. We might as well be friends.
You came to the bridge looking for my friendship?
Well... Captain! I sense Morganas to the north!
All hands to stations! Thanks for the heads-up, Saltshaker.
That's what friends do!
@BATTLE
Come on boys, let's give 'em a right cross!
@BATTLE
So, Captain, now that we're friends...

Fields.MenuText: ... You want something, don't you?
We're not exactly friends, Salt Lake City.
You want to play a game of tiddlywinks or something?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... yes.
Oh come on, now, Captain.
That's not quite what I had in mind.
I thought we could go fight a Morgana.
We're fighting Morganas practically every day.
Yes, but this one is special. Her name is Malice, and she is the best boxer the Morganas have. I want to fight her.
Wait, a Morgana boxer? And this is common knowledge?
Maybe not common. She tried to call out one of the Japanese Belles. Word gets around.
Among the Belles.
When a Morgana offers one of us the chance to punch her? Believe it.
And you want to fight her? You're a boxer?
I'd be ranked one of the best in Utah!
How do you rank globally?
I don't really know...
Oh, so this is about proving yourself?
Is that... bad?
Not if it means we can take out a dangerous Morgana in the process. Where is Malice?
Thank you, Captain! You won't regret this! One of my Belle friends said she's been bullying American forces around Wake Island in the Pacific. Thank you, thank you!
Morning, Saltshaker. What do you have there?
Oh, the Book of Mormon. I was just doing my morning quiet time.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you were Mormon.
But I thought you were a boxer.
There are times when you're quiet?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't publicize the fact.
There is some conflict, isn't there?
Ha, aren't you funny?
My faith is very important to me. But so is boxing, even though my church doesn't always take kindly to women fighting.
Yeah, admittedly I tend to think of Mormon women as not... breaking the mold.
I understand. I don't think we're supposed to stay home and keep sweet like a lot of men in the faith would have us do.
So how do you reconcile your faith and your dreams?
The Holy Bible is full of examples of women who broke the mold to fight for the kingdom of God –Deborah and Jael being a couple of examples.
*ALARM*
Looks like it's time to practice what you preach, Saltshaker.
Just let me get taped up!
@BATTLE
One of the sailors told me you were out here. Don't you think you should get inside, away from this storm?
No, I'm... Oh, no...
How long have you been vomiting? We should get you to the infirmary.
No, it's okay... I just get really... *urk* seasick in stormy weather...

Fields.MenuText: You really don't get out much, do you?
You've got to be kidding me.
Seasick? But you're a ship... spirit... thing.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what you're talking... oh, goodness.
You really think I'm kidding? Oh, my stomach...
I can't explain it, Captain, but...oh no, not again...
It's okay, just let it out.
*ALARM*
That's just what we need. Saltshaker, you stay here as long as you need to. See if you can aim some of that projectile vomit at the Morganas, huh?
Ha! Okay, thanks Cap... Oh, golly...
@BATTLE
Feeling better, Saltshaker?
Much better, thank you, Captain. Maybe it was all the fluids I lost, but I feel like we've veered off course.
We're going to stop in Pearl Harbor to refuel.
Oh, wonderful! It's like a second home to me! We should... Oh no...

Fields.MenuText: Are you going to puke again?
Shake it off, Saltshaker.
You sure that you can fight?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not down for the count, Captain.
Right... right...
*ALARM*
I don't think so...
Guns at the ready!
Yeah, we're not putting up with this! I call the big, ugly one!
@BATTLE
Goodbye, Pearl Harbor. See you again soon, I hope.
Hey, Saltshaker, while we were resupplying I heard one of the men at the docks call you "Swayback Maru." What's the story there?
Oh, it's because I sink down quite a bit when I'm fully loaded. I've been told I look like a saddle, but I try not to take gossip like that to heart.

Fields.MenuText: So you're not okay with the nickname?
You seem a little sensitive about it.
I can think of worse nicknames you could have.

Fields.DialogueText: It certainly isn't a name I would have chosen on my own.
Wouldn't you be?
Very helpful, Captain.
"Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out."
Does that mean you just ignore it?
"So where there is no talebearer, strife ceases." Proverbs, Captain.
So we should ignore it? Well, then I'll just have to call you Faith-ti-cuffs?
I actually like that one less...
*ALARM*
Go get them, Sway-- er, I mean, Saltshaker!
@BATTLE
So what's your plan once we find Malice, Saltshaker?
I will challenge her to a match!
And - even assuming she's lucid by Morgana standards -why would she accept a challenge to a one-on-one fight?
Because she wants to prove herself in the ring, of course!

Fields.MenuText: You think she wants to prove herself as much as you do?
You can't assume she's as honorable as you, Saltshaker.
What ring?! You're ships!

Fields.DialogueText: You don't fight unless you want to prove yourself.
Whether she's honorable or not, I'm confident I can best her.
You're so literal-minded, Captain.
Malice went out of her way to brag that she's the best boxer in the whole Morgana fleet. Don't you think she'll fight to keep that title?
Don't you think she'll do dirty Morgana things to keep that title, too?
I can take her, Captain. I'll prove it to you!
It's not a matter of proving--
There! Morganas to the northwest! Oh, I'm sorry. I interrupted you.
Never mind. Battle stations! We're going on the offensive!
@BATTLE
Captain, do you have a hero?

Fields.MenuText: So many. It's too hard to choose.
I was never shown a really good role model.
No, but I could really go for one with roast beef right now.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, come on now, Captain! Surely one sticks out.
That's... quite depressing, Captain.
Oh, Captain...
I think it's important to have people to look up to.
So who is yours?
Jack Dempsey, the World Heavyweight Champion.
Makes sense. He was a great boxer, and a Mormon.
Have you heard the recording of his 1919 fight against Jess Willard? He knocked Willard down seven times in the first round!
That is pretty incredible. Is that what you're going to do to Malice?
My, that would make for a great moment in history, wouldn't it?
*ALARM*
Ten to one that you can't beat them all in one round.
Sounds like a challenge, Captain!
@BATTLE
Hi there, Captain! Looking for me?

Fields.MenuText: What are you listening to? Banjo music?
What is that racket?
It sounds like someone's beating a kitten with a washboard in here.

Fields.DialogueText: Why, yes! What do you think?
Racket? You did not just insult my music!
When have you ever been near someone doing such a thing, and why didn't you stop them?!
Um... so this music we're listening to... is...
It's Eddie Peabody! Have you never heard him playing his banjo? He's magnificent!
Boxing and banjos. You have odd tastes, Saltshaker.
I think it's important that you're honest with yourself about what you like. Otherwise, you'll lead a very confused and pretentious life.
Welcome to the military. I was just coming to tell you that we're nearing Wake Island. If Malice's here, we'll find her soon.
Excellent! I'll get warmed up! Thank you for bringing me here, Captain. It was very kind of you.
Just make sure you put Malice down, Saltshaker. We need that victory here in the Pacific.
Captain! There you are! We've sighted incoming Morganas!
Seems we've hit a nerve. Malice must be close. Saltshaker, I need you on the bridge.
I'll put down anything between me and this title fight!
@BATTLE
Time for some Dempsey level fighting!
@BATTLE
Well, I hope that got somebody's attention...
There she is! It's Malice!
Well. She's... intense-looking.
And who do we have here?
I am the U.S.S. Salt Lake City! Malice, I'm here to fight you–in the ring!
You? You think you can defeat me? In a boxing match? Ha! That's cute.

Fields.MenuText: Saltshaker is the best boxer in the Pacific. Surely she's a match for you.
I've been telling her she's out of her league.
You're right, she is kind of cute...

Fields.DialogueText: Aren't you confident, little Captain?
How supportive you are, little Captain.
That's what you're thinking about right now?
Malice, I challenge you to a one-on-one boxing match! No interference from either of our fleets!
I'll take any opportunity I'm given to take on a heavy cruiser. Okay, Salt Lake City, it's a deal. Choose a time and a place, and our fleets can watch as I put you down.
Swayback Maru is fighting Malice, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Yes, and she's going to bring that monster down.
Yes, and she's going to lose us a ship.
I'm just here to watch two fine women get scrappy.

Fields.DialogueText: You really do believe in Salt Lake City, don't you, Captain?
Don't let Salt Lake City hear you saying that.
Okay...
You can just see them if you crane your neck. They're standing on the water between the two ships.
Of course they are.
It's a strange new world, isn't it?
There they go. Ooh, Malice's got a mean cross.
Saltshaker isn't maneuvering well. She's just getting pushed back and taking a beating.
Look at that pounding Malice's putting on her. Should we intervene?
No, the deal was no intervention from either side.
Malice's got her on the ropes now. She's just letting her have it.
Come on, Saltshaker. Get out of there... move your feet!
She can't even throw a punch. Should we fire on Malice, Captain?
We should have loaded her gloves with lead, or bombs.
Wait, Malice's tiring... Swayback's starting her assault! Look at her go!
She was just waiting for Malice to wear herself out. Good girl, Saltshaker...
Malice can't keep her arms up! She's done... Wait! The Morganas are firing on us, Captain!
Treacherous little... Return fire! The Morganas have broken the rules! Put them all under!
@BATTLE
Give the lady some room! She's coming to!
Don't Belles usually recover faster than this? She's been in and out ever since... you know.
No, this isn't normal.
Malice gave her a hell of a beating. In more ways than one.
Captain...
Saltshaker! Come on, just hold on a little bit longer. Let's get you into harbor at Wake and see what they can do.
I'm so sorry, Captain... I thought... I thought I could do it...
It was a one-on-one match... How could they...?

Fields.MenuText: You had her on the ropes.
You were winning, but the Morganas cheated!
You might have been punching above your weight.

Fields.DialogueText: They have no honor at all, do they?
I was so sure...
Can't trust 'em, Saltshaker.
Captain! Morgana rear-guards coming back for another pass!
We have to get Saltshaker into the harbor at Wake Island! Keep those bastards off of her!
@BATTLE
Hey Saltshaker, how are you? Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't know you were doing your quiet time.
It's okay, Captain. Come in! I was just reading Mosiah.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not familiar with that one.
Is that helping?
Ah yes, Mosiah, son of Nosiah, son of Posiah.

Fields.DialogueText: It's not as well known.
A little, yes. I think so.
Not... quite.
It's in the Book of Mormon. There's one verse that I always have to remind myself of over and over again. Mosiah 4, verse 27.
What's it about?
"And see that all these things are done in wisdom and order; for it is not requisite that a man should run faster than he has strength."
Ah, you feel like you got ahead of yourself a little bit?
It's a tendency of mine.
I can see that. Are you feeling better now?
Yes, the technicians here have been taking very good care of me. They can't fix all the hull damage here, but I should be fully operational soon.
You know, to be fair, you were beating Malice.
I was, wasn't I?! Did you see that uppercut I got in on her?! I shouldn't have trusted that a Morgana would fight fair. I won't make that mistake again.
That's good to hear. Oh, here. I brought you something.
A root beer?! Oh, Captain, you're spoiling me! Thank you!
Not to make you down it quickly...
I'll put it on ice, Captain. It's a gift. It needs to be savored.
@BATTLE
We've received word from New Zealand. Malice has been sighted off their coast.
Then let's go finish what we started!
No making deals with Morganas this time, right?
Nope! I'm not trusting a word they say!

Fields.MenuText: That makes me feel much better.
About time.
I'm really glad I could teach you a deep sense of distrust.

Fields.DialogueText: I should have been more wary last time.
I'm sure your judgment has been flawless the whole of your life.
Well, when you say it like that...
Morganas ahead!
They've got a mean look about them. Let's approach carefully, Captain!
I'm glad you're learning, Saltshaker...
@BATTLE
Wow, those are the Marshall Islands?! They're so neat!
Captain, we're receiving reports from Command. The Morganas have set up multiple blockades throughout the Marshall Islands to intercept ships passing through.
Then we'd be doing the world a favor to blow them to pieces.
Sounds dangerous, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: About as dangerous as a Dempsey title fight?
About as dangerous as going up against a hulking Morgana by yourself?
About as dangerous as caffeine and alcohol?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, when you put it like that, I couldn't possibly refuse!
I suppose I have taken bigger risks in my life.
Hey now! Watch it. I could beat you to a pulp, if I wanted.
Do you have a Mormon verse for a trial like this, Saltshaker?
From Alma 36, "Whosoever shall put their trust in God shall be supported in their trials, and their troubles, and their afflictions, and shall be lifted up at the last day."
Hear that, men? Let's make it to the last day! Blockade number one! All guns, at my signal!
@BATTLE
Captain, look! Americans fighting the second Morgana blockade! We need to help them!
Makes sense they would want to take back ground here. All guns! Try not to hit the Yankees!
@BATTLE
Much thanks, Swayback Maru. We heard about your upcoming fight against Malice. The stars and stripes back home are cheering for you!
That means the world to me, my friends! Safe journey!
Wow, did you hear that, Captain? My countrymen know about this fight!
Maybe it will be broadcast like a Dempsey fight!
EEEEEEE! Could you imagine?! Could you IMAGINE?!

Fields.MenuText: I can imagine! And it would be spectacular!
Okay, that's enough of that.
Wow, you just shattered all the glass on the bridge. Well done.

Fields.DialogueText: AAAAAAA! I have to go train!
But-but-but...
Oops. I'll go get a broom...
Relax. It's all under control.
You know, Captain, I've realized something. I don't want to beat Malice for the "best boxer in the world" title this time.
You want to do it for America? Revenge? The Salt Lake Temple?
No, I want to do it for the crew. And... for you.
What? Wait, why?
Because you all have supported me through the match-up, the fight, my recovery. I know you all just want the world to be safe. So I want to put down Malice for you.

Fields.MenuText: That's sweet, Saltshaker. Thank you.
How about we do it together?
I do enjoy watching you two ladies go at each other...

Fields.DialogueText: S-sure, Captain.
Together?
Oh, goodness, Captain.
You would make a great boxing manager.
If you think about it, I already am. I just manage a lot of different fighters and call it a fleet.
That's true! You're like the best manager ever!
*ALARM*
Looks like it's time for me to manage again. All hands!
@BATTLE
Saltshaker, I've heard some disturbing reports that you have been beating up my men. Would you like to explain that?
Oh, I just challenged a couple of them to a boxing match!

Fields.MenuText: Okay, but this is a Navy ship. There are rules against fighting.
Do I really need to explain how grossly irresponsible that is?
And you beat them? That's fantastic!

Fields.DialogueText: Think of it less as fighting, and more as training.
Grossly might be a bit of an overstatement.
Of course I beat them!
They were making fun of me for being a boxer and said that I could only beat girls. So I challenged them!
You broke one of their noses.
He didn't keep his hands up!
Will you ever not need to prove yourself?
Ooh, Morganas coming from the west! I'll bet I can beat them too!
I guess that answers my question.
@BATTLE
Oh hello, Saltshaker. What are... Are you eating straight sauerkraut?
Yep! It's my favorite food! Want some?

Fields.MenuText: No, I like at least a hot dog with my sauerkraut.
Sure, maybe it'll add some flavor to these rations.
No, it wouldn't go well with my glass of straight ketchup.

Fields.DialogueText: No, no, hot dogs distract from the flavor.
That's the spirit!
What?! Oh, you're messing with me, aren't you?
When you know what you like, you just gotta go for it!
That does seem to be your motto.
Captain, sorry to bother you in the galley, but we're overtaking a Morgana patrol. They haven't spotted us yet.
Right. Swayback Maru, to the bridge! Leave your sauerkraut here. We wouldn't want them to smell us coming.
Ha ha! Maybe they'd mistake us for a hot dog cart!
@BATTLE
Just got word from New Zealand command that Malice has taken refuge at Chatham Island. They might have a small battlegroup ready to assist, too.
That's going to be a big battle, Captain! I'm excited!

Fields.MenuText: Good! Get ready to take that title!
You should be. We sailed all over the Pacific for you.
Just keep your hands up, kid. You'll do fine.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll spend the rest of the day training!
Hey, if we take down Malice, that isn't just a victory for me - it's a victory for everyone!
I always do, Captain!
I wonder what I'll do once I beat the best boxer in the world...
Well, what did Jack Dempsey do?
He defended his title for years afterward!
There you go. You'll just have to defend your title against all the little upstarts who want to be the best.
Captain, we have Morganas sweeping up from the south and turning west. No shots fired yet.
They're trying to distract us from Malice. Let's chuck some shells at them, but stay on course for Chatham Island.
@BATTLE
Morning, Saltshaker. Hope I'm not disturbing you.
I'm basically just reading, Captain. You don't need to be cautious just because it's a religious book.

Fields.MenuText: Just erring on the side of caution. I can be jealous of my own religious book time.
True, but I don't know exactly what your rituals are.
I would hate for a lightning bolt to strike my bridge for interrupting.

Fields.DialogueText: I do appreciate your consideration, Captain.
Oh, calm down, Captain.
That would be quite unexpected. Shocking, even–ho!
Mormonism is a message of hope and renewal, Captain, not condemnation. You don't need to- Uh-oh. Morganas. They're up early.
Excuse me, Morganas, have you heard the good word?!
Ha ha! I can't believe you just said that...
@BATTLE
Okay, why is there a punching bag hanging in my bridge?
Swayback Maru hung it up there earlier, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: This is getting out of hand.
And now I'm taking it down.
Oh, good. Now I have something to take out my rage on.

Fields.DialogueText: What's getting out of hand?
Captain? What are you doing with my punching bag?
Oh, Captain, your punching technique is all wrong.
Saltshaker, why is this in here?
I have a big fight coming up, Captain! I need to be in tip-top shape! Here, will you hold the bag while I hit it?
Have I been demoted from captain to personal trainer without knowing it?
Captain! Morganas closing in from the east and the west!
They know we're getting close to Malice. All gunners, pick your targets!
@BATTLE
New Zealand command just hailed us. They're wishing us good luck, Captain.
Yes, they're ready for... Saltshaker, what have you got there?
My letterman sweater! I made it myself! Do you like it?

Fields.MenuText: Saltshaker. Appropriate.
When you're actually wearing it, are both arms the same length? I mean, it's great, but...
Well knitted! It looks pretty cute, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't it, though?
I suppose my knitting skills could use some work...
Aw, thank you, Captain.
I worked really hard on it. I need to make an entrance for my big fight!
Oh, they'll know you're there.
I want to thank you before we head in there, Captain. You have been a very dear friend and I...
Chatham Island ahead! And here comes the welcoming party!
You can thank me later, Saltshaker! Let's open a path, people!
@BATTLE
They're everywhere, Captain!
We found the hornets' nest! I need your help to aim the guns, Swayback!
There's Malice! She's making an armed retreat into that lagoon! We have to follow her!

Fields.MenuText: We will once we're taking less fire!
Get your priorities in order, Saltshaker!
Let her stew in that lagoon for a while and think about what she's done!

Fields.DialogueText: No, we have to go now!
I have them in order!
I don't know if that's the best plan, Captain!
We have a fire on the top deck!
Get that fire out! We're going in hot! Front turrets, focus on the mouth of that lagoon! Saltshaker, Mormonize me!
"For, behold, I have refined thee, I have chosen thee in the furnace of affliction!" 1 Nephi 20.
That's what I like to hear!
@BATTLE
Look at all the Morganas here!
There's Malice at the far end of it! Are you ready for this, Saltshaker?
I'll take out Malice if you can cover me!

Fields.MenuText: You're going fist-to-fist with her again?!
This didn't work out well last time!
Oh, I've got you covered like a hot dog in sauerkraut!

Fields.DialogueText: Of course.
That doesn't matter.
Thanks, Captain.
I won't fail with you backing me up! Get me over to her, and I'll deliver the finishing blow!
You're going to ram her, aren't you?
Can you think of anything more fitting?
Saltshaker...

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad to have her on my team.
She really is something special, isn't she?
